history.content:
If it is your only class during the summer it won't be that bad. It does move relatively fast in the sense that you are cramming a 16 week course into 8 weeks, but if it is your only commitment then you can fully commit yourself in the material.

If you want to get ahead you can go to any of the previous websites and just start watching/reading their webcasts/notes. Maybe you can even familiarize yourself with the syntax of some of the programming languages ahead of time like C.

As far as content is concerned, they cover the same material more or less. They might, depending on time, cut out something minor...but for the most part you will be learning the same things as a regular semester.

Sometimes the summer sessions cover more than the regular semester. For instance, CS 70 over the past summer covered Chinese Remainder theorem, but FA 19 CS 70 did not.

children.subject: I agree with student answer. I had a lot of fun taking 61C last summer - in fact, I'm glad I took it over the summer rather than during the school year because it gave me the chance to really focus on the class and learn the material well.

history.content:
I read through some previous threads that seemed to mainly be asking about the workload, so hopefully I'm not asking something too repetitive but I wanted to get some info about 61c over the summer!

(background: I'm currently a 2nd year; a bunch of peers told me not to do 61c over the summer bc of the amount of content you have to binge-learn,, but if my internship gets cancelled this summer, I will try to recruit for the fall and if I'm not at school next fall I feel like I will fall behind in coursework because most of the UDs I wanna take need 61c and then everything will be squished to senior year)

does 61c over the summer cover the same extent of content as over the semester? I know it is a very important prereq for a good few upper divs so I don't want to be lacking in knowledge for those classes. does the summer session go too fast to absorb the material well enough (I am dedicated to doing well in it and this will be my only commitment over the summer if I decide to do 61c)

also, any advice on stuff I should prelearn so I shouldn't fall behind during the summer session?

thanks a bunch! :)
history.subject: 61c over the summer
